tweet: I am also pleased that these important housing protections were incorporated into the #EqualityAct (#HR5) and I look forward to voting on this anti-discrimination package soon. #LGBTQ

In 2019, it's unacceptable the majority of states still have no laws prohibiting housing discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity. I'm glad the bill I'm introducing today with Rep. @SusanWBrooks, @RepWexton and @RepBrianFitz has bipartisan support to fix.

No American should face discrimination finding a home because of who they are or who they love. Proud to again introduce #FairandEqualHousingAct to extend federal protections ensuring all #LGBTQ individuals and couples can access housing w/o prejudice.  https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-brooks-wexton-fitzpatrick-introduce-bipartisan-legislation-extending … pic.twitter.com/jSzdZ4QXFV

In the face of rising antisemitism here and worldwide, we must all be extra vigilant lest we feed into the hateful rhetoric that leads to violence such as we’ve seen at the Chabad Synagogue in Poway, Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh, and in cities around the world.

It’s extremely disturbing that the New York Times would publish a disgusting antisemitic cartoon as it did last week in its international edition. While the Times formally apologized, I hope they will look inward & implement formal procedures to ensure it never happens again.

I’m back in Washington today, but keeping in contact by calling back some of the people who have written in over last two weeks. Thanks for reaching out with a variety of opinions on the Mueller report, trade, and student loans. pic.twitter.com/ujfqbhy6k0
I continue to pray for the recovery of those injured in the shooting and offer my deepest condolences to the loved ones of the woman who died.

While we mourn this tragedy, we must also come together to condemn anti-Semitism and hate in all their forms, and condemn those who spread it. Every American of every religion has a fundamental right to practice their faith without fear of violence.

I am profoundly saddened by the shooting at the Chabad of Poway synagogue in California, which comes as Jews around the world celebrate the last day of Passover, and exactly six months after the attack on Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh.
I’m watching these reports of a shooting at a California synagogue with grave concern. Hoping and praying for no loss of life. https://twitter.com/NBCNews/status/1122224551713284099 …
We have a responsibility to provide our first responder heroes, who put their lives on the line to save others, the resources they need to keep themselves safe.

I also requested that investigators examine the efforts of our first responders, including assessing whether our local departments were properly notified and fully prepared with the necessary training and equipment to safely respond to this incident.

While my first thoughts remain with the individuals hospitalized as a result of yesterday's ammonia spill, it's critical that we start investigating how this accident occurred and what steps are necessary to prevent similar disasters in the future. https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-statement-investigation-ammonia-spill …

Vaccines are safe and they protect you and the community around you. During #WorldImmunizationWeek, check with your health provider if you are up-to-date on your immunizations. https://www.nprillinois.org/post/amid-us-measles-outbreak-illinois-announces-push-vaccinations …

I will request the EPA examine this incident for any needed updates to the Clean Air Act and Toxic Substances Control Act, as well as ask the National Transportation Safety Board to review our laws and regulations concerning the transportation of hazardous chemicals.

With the spill now cleaned, our communities deserve assurances that we are taking all necessary precautions to prevent a similar accident in the future. The immediate next action is to investigate how this accident happened.

I am incredibly grateful for the immediate response of roughly 140 first responders who sprung into action to contain and clean up this spill. The ammonia release sent 37 people to the hospital. I am continuing to monitor their progress and pray for their full and fast recovery. https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1121483304161689601 …

Please also note the following school closings: all schools in Beach Park School District 3, all schools in Zion Elementary School District 6, Zion-Benton Township High School, and Prairie Trail School

I urge everyone who lives within a mile of the spill to follow the guidance of our first responders: stay indoors, keep your doors and windows closed, and turn off any air conditioning or ventilation systems. https://twitter.com/newssun/status/1121413696515915776 …

Our nation gets just one chance each decade to count its population. Thanks to everyone who came to our Community Briefing on the 2020 Census last night in Waukegan to learn more about why it's so important that each person in our communities is counted! pic.twitter.com/OmNoCcMEcl
Wonderful to help deliver meals this morning with @hanulusa and @AgeOptions Meals on Wheels program. pic.twitter.com/yfInACYMhy

Earlier this year, I was proud to vote for climate legislation that would return the United States to the Paris Climate Agreement and require a plan to meet our emission reduction targets. #ActOnClimate

Today marks the 50th observance of Earth Day, a time to reflect on the gifts of our natural environment and our responsibility to protect our home for the next generations. #EarthDay pic.twitter.com/n6JacNZGWm
Great to catch up with everyone who attended our #CongressonYourCorner this Saturday in Mount Prospect. Thanks for coming out! pic.twitter.com/dZBVpoMHGm

I am profoundly saddened to learn of these horrific Easter Sunday terrorist attacks in Sri Lanka, and I send my condolences to the loved ones of those killed. We must continue to work to build a world where every person is safe to practice their faith in peace.
A very happy Easter Sunday to all those celebrating today in the Tenth District and around the world! Wishing you and your loved ones a blessed and joyful holiday.
Tonight, Jews at home and around the world will gather to celebrate the first night of Passover and commemorate the story of Exodus. Wishing all who celebrate this evening a happy Pesach!

Great turnout for our workshop today on starting and growing a small business. My thanks to Mitch Bienvenue of the Illinois Small Business Development and International Trade Center and @SBAgov for leading this informative event. Small business are the engine of our economy! pic.twitter.com/IM7UI0kUj1

Since the beginning of the investigation, I have repeated that I will be guided by the facts and will follow them wherever they lead. Only by fully understanding what happened in 2016 will help us better defend against foreign efforts to influence future elections.
It is important that Congress review the full, unredacted report and that Special Counsel Mueller publicly testify to share these findings with the American public.

In particular, the Special Counsel report makes clear that the President sought repeatedly to undermine and interfere with the investigation, and in some instances was prevented from doing so only by his staff ignoring or refusing to carry out his instructions.
The facts as laid out in the report stand in stark contrast to Attorney General Barr’s attempts to spin the conclusions through a pre-release summary and press conference.
I am pleased that the Special Counsel report is finally public and the American people can now read the findings for themselves on foreign interference in the 2016 election.
Great visit with the 5th grade students at Glen Flora Elementary who just finished their unit studying equal rights and justice. pic.twitter.com/pfGI6EAdLh

Glad that our office could participate in the senior resource day at Zion Park District and share ways our constituent service representatives can help resolve issues with Medicare, Social Security, and more. pic.twitter.com/gq5qjNPsvd

I'm so inspired by their willingness to turn their own personal losses into advocacy on behalf of other families facing the same unimaginable tragedy.We're gaining momentum - for the fist time we have bipartisan support in the Senate - and I'll continue to work to get it passed.

I met today with Barry Kluger and Alison Jacobson about the bipartisan Parental Bereavement Act that I introduced earlier this year to expand #FMLA so employees can take the unpaid time off they need to care for their families and heal following the death of a child. pic.twitter.com/xNiOstUDNu

I was proud to vote for Net Neutrality legislation today because it’s vital the Internet remain open, accessible, and uncensored for all. This bill codifies the principles of an open internet, including no blocking, no throttling, and no paid prioritization. #SavetheNet pic.twitter.com/gxKb5nk88V

Women are paid just 80 cents for every $1 a man makes on average. It's unacceptable that in 2019 women are still fighting for equal pay for equal work. I was proud to vote to pass the Paycheck Fairness Act last week and will keep working to close the gender pay gap #EqualPayDay
